World frontpage News UK & World News News The once-hidden Cornish beach with picture-perfect views 'could be in Bali' Pedn Vounder offers a stunning combination of crystal-clear turquoise waters and pristine white sands devonlive Bookmark Share News By Laura Mckenna Laura Mckenna 01:00, 19 JUL 2024 Bookmark (Image: Getty) Nestled along the Cornish coast, Pedn Vounder boasts is aesthetically pleasing it could easily be mistaken for the exotic shores of somewhere like Thailand or Bali. Perched below the imposing cliffs of Treryn Dinas, this beach graces the eastern end of Porthcurno Cove. The picture-perfect setting is stunning, but its beauty is ephemeral as it is only visible for a few hours each day. Accessible via a walk along the bay from Porthcurno Beach at low tide or by navigating a steep cliff path, Pedn Vounder has become a cherished spot for dedicated hikers, beach enthusiasts and the occasional naturist. However, the beach vanishes under the waves at high tide, lending it an air of mystery and enchantment for those who time their visit perfectly. READ MORE: The West Country village with cobbled streets and sandy beaches that is 'straight out of a postcard' Pedn Vounder is hard to get to, but well worth it when you get there (Image: Getty) Once a hidden gem, this secluded spot has risen to fame as one of Cornwall's most Instagrammed beaches. Despite its newfound fame, it remains unspoilt and untouched enough to have previously been named among the world's best beaches for two years in a row. Joining the ranks of illustrious names such as Australia's Turquoise Bay and the Philippines' Secret Lagoon, Pedn Vounder earned its place on the annual 'The 50 Best Beaches In The World' list. This ranking was compiled using a combination of media mentions, official Blue Flag statuses, social media buzz, and input from the Big 7 Travel editorial team, reports the Mirror . Isaac Clams, a travel vlogger, extolled the virtues of Pedn Vounder on TikTok. He dubbed it "the Bali of the UK" and showcased its unique sandbank and awe-inspiring vistas. In a brief TikTok video, he and his travel companion stand overlooking the beach. He exclaims: "We've just arrived at the only sandbank in the whole of the UK" followed by an excited cheer as they take in the stunning coastline below. The secluded beach has won over nearly everyone who's visited, earning a perfect five out of five score on Tripadvisor. One visitor hailed it as "the best of Cornwall beaches and one of the best in the world", while another simply described it as "breathtakingly beautiful". The beach at Porthcurno towards Logans Rock was featured in Poldark (Image: Getty) To the east of the beach, you'll find the renowned Logan Rock, a 70-ton granite block that can be rocked back and forth by a single person. The area also had a starring role in the TV adaptation of "Poldark," where it was portrayed as Nampara Cove in a dream sequence. Despite its growing popularity, Pedn Vounder still maintains its magical charm, beloved by both locals and tourists alike.
